hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 20-day realized volatility falls below its 100-day rolling 20th percentile (compression) AND the 5-day average daily trading range is below 2.5%, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev) will signal a transition from NEUTRAL to BULL regime with 70% probability over the next 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended volatility compression often precedes significant directional moves. Breakouts from tight ranges in neutral regimes have historically led to sustained trends as trapped positions get unwound.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 20th percentile of 100-day rolling window
BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% price appreciation from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confirmed by regime model)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5% price decline from entry OR volatility expands > 50% from entry level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts result in false moves (return below breakout level within 3 days) OR lead to BEAR regime instead of BULL.
